supportDesc.support: In a tabula ansata, 28 cm wide × 16 cm high. large block capitals, 8 cm high.

div.ab: Below this, in a partly-preserved tabula ansata ca. 21 × 12 cm, in 2 cm high letters, again: Then, incised below that in a space 19 cm wide, in letters 3.5–7 cm high: This comes from ψύχω. cf. T15.2 and T29.5. “I have been chilled!” Is the reference to the cooling shade of the basement level? The case of T29.5, however, where it is written on a testicle, suggests that a sexual meaning (or double-entendre?) may be intended, whether that refers to the cooling of emotion or more specifically to the loss of an erection. There appears to be one stroke after the word, whether connected with it cannot be determined.
